data.title: Good Burgers but Great Shakes!!
data.text:
We visited with our friends who are locals and our kids (we're visiting Ca) and this place is their favorite, I can see why!

The meals are generous, tasty and served fast and fresh.  The Shakes are brilliant, a true old style slake that comes with its own top up cup as it doesn't fit in the glass! 

The service was friendly and helpful!

data.title: Nice place
data.text: Not as good as use to be, food okay service okay no one is in hurry to get anything done. As shops in center have gone out the business has to. As far as rating against other Ruby's it's at the bottom.

data.title: Wonderful dinner with family in a 50's style "burger joint".
data.text: Ruby's has a wonderful menu but the burgers are what draws the most attention.  I enjoyed mine with a little avocado while others chose spicy flavors or loads of bacon.  We were in a party of 12 which could typically put a strain on restaurant staff.  But, not at Ruby's on Barranca Parkway.  They took care of our needs without a blink.  That is saying a lot considering we had 2 4-year olds plus two other children in our party.  The food was excellent and I thoroughly enjoyed my strawberry lemonade.  I recommend Ruby's for people who enjoy a great hamburger, a little nostalgia, and who appreciate great service from great waitstaff, cooks, and management.  This helped to make our visit with family extra pleasant and memorable.

data.title: Beautiful view
data.text: Ruby's Diner has a lot of OC locations around water. This one has a relaxing vibe with a view of the lake. Service is kind and efficient. Large parties can bring the noise level very high. We like to avoid main dining times, it is more relaxing that way.

data.title: Great food, Great location...
data.text: I have been to Ruby's before so I already knew the food would not disappoint. I was not aware however that I would have such a great view from our seat. We were seated in a booth near a window facing a lake. We had a great meal and the location was mostly empty so the service was quick.

data.title: Fun, family friendly, themed burger joint
data.text:
This was the first place we had eaten at when we arrived in America and went there with the family we were visiting.
The restaurant was a modern take on the 1950's diners.  It was bright, colorful and clean.
The food choices were sufficient to need some time to decide and the servings were substantial.  No need to upsize unless you are really hungry.  But save some room for desserts.  The sundae's are huge!
The staff were friendly and helpful and this only contributed to a lovely night out.

data.title: Shake me!!
data.text: Went in on a Tursday with a group of six, seated within 10 minutes and had one of the best balanced and tasty salads ever. The Kids loved their menues and we where even offered free balloons for the kids. Even though it was packed and the staff extra busy - they came through with flying colours!

data.title: good couple of burgers for Airport location
data.text: We stopped here for a burger prior to boarding and were pleasantly surprised.  My wife had the Portobello mushroom burger with grilled onions and provolone, and I just had the regular cheeseburger.  Both burgers were quite good, and they come with the skinny fries, nice and crispy.

data.title: Standard burger, nothing to make a special trip for
data.text:
I've been in Irvine on business for a few days and am highly disappointed on the food options here.  After asking several locals for recommendations for a good burger place (I'm a burger snob and always want to find the good ones), nobody could give me any leads except for chains like In and Out, or Ruth Chris for an upscale burger.  My own research turned up very little but I stumbled on Ruby's Diner.  

After finally finding the place, I had the address but there were no signs--at least that I could see--and the restaurant itself was hidden behind a Barnes and Noble, it was a very typical, almost stereotypical diner chain...  white walls, bright red vinyl booths, etc.  I ordered the basic burger and it was served just as you would expect--in a paper-lined, red plastic basket.  The burger was also half wrapped in paper.

I knew when I ordered that it would not be anything special when I wasn't asked how I wanted it cooked.  It was a flat burger, flat-grilled, with fresh lettuce and an egg-bread bun.  Quite frankly, the bun was the best part.  There was nothing particularly bad about the burger, but nothing that set it apart from any other.  That's about all I can say; it's exactly the type of burger you'd find at an American Graffiti style diner.

The fries were the standard frozen then fried type, also expected.  The prices were about average and the service was friendly, but a bit on the slow side.  The one cool thing was that they have a fabulous, big (probably about three feet long) model of a vintage Chris Craft boat revolving in the center of the dining room.

Other than the model boat, I would have been better off going to In and Out Burger or Smashburger.

data.title: Very nice view of the lake
data.text: Ruby's is a classic. Great breakfast, lunch and diner. Everything is good and the service is always nice.

data.title: Highly recommend
data.text: I ate here with my son and wife. The booth was clean, restaurant was bright and the staff was very friendly. Each one of our dishes as delicious and came out as requested. I would definitely eat here again.

data.title: Dining at the Orange County Airport
data.text:
The restaurant is located behind security in the Orange County Airport.  We arrived at about 1:30 PM on a weekday.  We were seated after a few minutes after the hostess located and clean a table for us.

We waited about a half an hour for meals to be deliver.  The waiter was pleasant.  He delivered out meals when they were ready.  The party next to us also had to wait an extended period of time for their meals.  I was surprised the length of time for a meal to be serve at an airport restaurant.

The sandwich and salad were very good.

data.title: nice view of the mission
data.text: Sat on rooftop desk with mission view.  Tortilla soup was good.  Whole different ambience than the downstairs diner

data.title: A dinner with the kids
data.text:
Went for dinner her with the kids as part of a school promotion so the place was full of families and kids that my kids know from school. 

Basic sort of burger and shakes fare here but the quality was quite good and the service reasonable. 

Our shakes came out promptly and were awesome. You can tell that the shakes are made by blending the favor with some ice cream. They are thick and flavorful with a good selection of flavors. I had the black cherry and it was very good. One kids has peanut butter and it wasn't totally blended through which was actually nice as she had little bits of flavor from chunks of peanut butter. Great!

We had burgers, sandwiches and a hot dog with fries. The food was a bit slow in coming to the table. Somewhat understandable due to the rush of families in the restaurant. The waiter did come by and update us our meal so I can excuse the slowness. 

The food is good and what you would expect from this type of restaurant. Nothing special but met expectations. 

The decor is diner although this one has a nautical theme or sorts with lots of models of vintage Chris Craft boats which was slightly interesting. The kids also got coloring placemats and instead of the usual three crayons the placements had a scratch color to them. The kids scartch the placemat and color reveals itself. Nice and tidy and clean and a bit different but did cramp the creative stylings of my kids who usually do something different.

data.title: The Grand boys favorite
data.text: Ruby's is the place my grandsons want to eat every time we come to Irvine for a visit.  They love the Mac and Cheese and the kid size hamburgers.  I like their burgers with BBQ sauce.  They also have great salads and the fish tacos were spectacular and an enormous portion.  It is typical diner food with shakes that take me back 55 years to my youth.  They cater to families with small children and are eager to substitute fruit for fries on mom's request.  For a nostalgic return back to the 50's, this is the place to visit.

data.title: Great view and Greasy food
data.text: The location of this restaurant is extremely nice and the view of the lake makes it one of the nicest places in Irvine. The service was also great. The food however was very greasy and we could not eat it. I suggest that if you go to the restaurant and don't enjoy greasy food to ask the server to request the cook to take it easy on the oil or butter.

data.title: A Ruby's everywhere you turn!
data.text: Our favorite Ruby's diners were the Balboa Pier location and the Shake Shack, on PCH overlooking Crystal Cove park. What a great view from both locations!  Good food and great prices as well. Be sure to try a hot fudge sundae at the Shake Shack!

data.title: Depends on Location
data.text: I ate at 3 Ruby's while I was in California for a long weekend; Irvine on Barranca Pkwy, Spectrum Mall, and at the SNA airport. Ruby's on Barranca and at the Spectrum were WONDERFUL. The one at the airport was not so hot with awful service and food that didn't even seem like it was from the same restaurant chain. I would suggest anybody, all ages, to eat here for breakfast, lunch, or dinner but just not at the SNA Airport.

data.title: Still great!!
data.text: I used to live in Irvine and loved this diner. On my trip to California, I made a visit and was not disappointed. Great classic diner with the best malts I've had ;)

data.title: One of the Nicer Diners
data.text: This is one of the nicer diners you will see. It overlooks a man made lake off Barranca Parkway in Irvine. The place is large and clean with with decent service and decent food. We had a cobb salad, hamburger and onion rings. All were pretty good. The cobb salad was large with lots of stuff in there (chicken, avocado, red cabbage, egg, tomato, bacon etc.) just like it should be. The nice setting makes this place seem like more than just a diner.
